source_sentence: 北涼天竺三藏曇無讖譯
translation: Northern Liang Tianzhushu Sanzang translated by Dharmakṣema

source_sentence: 迦葉菩薩品第十二之二
translation: The Twelfth and Second Part of the Chapter of Kāśyapa Bodhisattva

source_sentence: 「◎善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 若言如來畢竟涅槃、不畢竟涅槃，是人不解如來意故，作如是說。
translation: If someone says the Tathāgata is ultimately nirvāṇa and not ultimately nirvāṇa, that person doesn't understand the Tathāgata's meaning and makes such a statement because they don't understand it.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 是香山中有諸仙人五萬三千，皆於過去迦葉佛所，修諸功德未得正道，
translation: In that mountain of fragrance there were fifty-three thousand holy ones, all cultivating virtues in the presence of the Buddhas of the past and not yet attaining enlightenment.

source_sentence: 親近諸佛聽受正法。
translation: They'll become intimate with the buddhas and listen to the right teaching.

source_sentence: 如來欲為如是人故，告阿難言：『過三月已，吾當涅槃。』
translation: Desiring for such a person, the Tathāgata told Ānanda, 'After three months have passed, I will enter nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 諸天聞已，其聲展轉乃至香山。
translation: When the gods hear it, their voice spreads and grows up to the mountain of fragrance.

source_sentence: 諸仙聞已，即生悔心，作如是言：『云何我等得生人中，不親近佛？
translation: After hearing this, the ṛṣi became remorseful and said, 'How can we be born among humans and not associate with the Buddha?'

source_sentence: 諸佛如來出世甚難，如優曇花，我今當往至世尊所聽受正法。』
translation: It's very difficult for the buddha-tathāgatas to appear in the world like the udumbara flower, so now I will go to the Bhagavān and listen to the right teaching.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 爾時五萬三千諸仙即來我所，我時即為如應說法：『諸大士！
translation: At that point, 53,000 sages came to me, and I then explained the teaching as it should be: 'Great men!

source_sentence: 色是無常。
translation: Form is impermanent.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 色之因緣是無常故，無常因生，色云何常？
translation: The causes and conditions of form are impermanent because they arise from impermanent causes, so how can form be permanent?

source_sentence: 乃至識亦如是。』
translation: It's likewise with consciousness.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸仙聞是法已，即時獲得阿羅漢果。
translation: After hearing this teaching, the sages immediately attained the fruit of arhatship.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 拘尸那竭有諸力士三十萬人，無所繫屬，自恃憍恣、色力命財，狂醉亂心。
translation: In Kuśinagara there were 30,000 strong men who had no attachments, relied on self-restraint, form, strength, life, and possessions, and became mad and intoxicated.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我為調伏諸力士故，告目連言：『汝當調伏如是力士。』
translation: In order to tame the strong men, I told Maudgalyāyana, 'You must tame such a strong man.'

source_sentence: 時目犍連敬順我教，於五年中種種教化，乃至不能令一力士受法調伏。
translation: Maudgalyāyana then honored my teaching and taught it in five years of various ways, even to the point where he couldn't allow a single strong man to receive the Dharma and be disciplined.

source_sentence: 是故我復為彼力士告阿難言：『過三月已，吾當涅槃。』
translation: That's why I again told Ānanda for that strong man, 'After three months have passed, I will enter nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 時諸力士聞是語已，相與集聚，平治道路。
translation: When the strong men heard these words, they gathered together and pacified the roads.

source_sentence: 過三月已，我時便從毘舍離國，至拘尸那城，中路遙見諸力士輩，即自化身為沙門像，
translation: After three months had passed, I came from Vaiśālī to the city of Kuśinagara and saw the warriors at a distance in the middle of the road. Then I transformed myself into the form of a śramaṇa.

source_sentence: 往力士所作如是言：『諸童子！
translation: He went to the strong man and said, 'Boys!

source_sentence: 作何事耶？』
translation: What's the work you'll do?'

source_sentence: 力士聞已，皆生瞋恨，作如是言：『沙門！
translation: After hearing this, the strong man became angry and said, 'Sir, ascetic!

source_sentence: 汝今云何謂我等輩為童子耶？』
translation: How do you now say that we are children?'

source_sentence: 我時語言：『汝今大眾三十萬人，盡其身力，不能移此微末小石，云何不名為童子乎？』
translation: I then said, 'Now, 30,000 people in the assembly can't move this tiny little stone with all their physical strength, so why isn't it called a boy?'

source_sentence: 諸力士言：『汝若謂我為童子者，當知汝即是大人也。』
translation: The strong men said, 'If you say I'm a boy, you should know that you're a great man.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時以足二指，掘出此石。
translation: At the time, I dug out this stone with two fingers at my feet.

source_sentence: 是諸力士見是事已，即於己身生輕劣想，復作是言：『沙門！
translation: When those strong men saw this, they gave rise to thoughts of despising themselves and again said, 'As a monk!

source_sentence: 汝今復能移徙此石，令出道不？』
translation: Now, can you move this stone again and cause it to leave the path?'

source_sentence: 我言童子：『何因緣故，嚴治此道？』
translation: I said to the boy, 'What are the causes and conditions that strictly govern this path?'

source_sentence: 諸力士言：『沙門！
translation: The strong men said, 'As a monk!

source_sentence: 汝不知耶？
translation: Don't you know?

source_sentence: 釋迦如來當由此路至娑羅林，入於涅槃。
translation: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni then proceeded on this road to the sal trees and entered nirvana.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，我等平治。』
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, we'll be pacified.'

source_sentence: 我時讚言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: I then praised him, saying, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 童子！
translation: Boy!

source_sentence: 汝等已發如是善心，吾當為汝除去此石。』
translation: You've arisen such a good intention, and I will remove this stone for you.'

source_sentence: 我時以手舉擲大石，高至阿迦尼吒。
translation: At the time, I raised a large rock with my hand and tossed it as high as Akaniṣṭha.

source_sentence: 時諸力士見石在空，皆生驚怖，尋欲四散。
translation: When the strong men saw the stone in the sky, they all became frightened and dispersed in search of it.

source_sentence: 我復告言：『諸力士等，汝今不應生恐怖心，各欲散去。』
translation: Again, I told them, 'Now, you strong men, don't become frightened; each of you should scatter and leave.'

source_sentence: 諸力士言：『沙門！
translation: The strong men said, 'As a monk!

source_sentence: 若能救護我者，我當安住。』
translation: If you can rescue me, I will abide in peace.'

source_sentence: 爾時我復以手接石，置之右掌。
translation: At that point, I again touched the stone with my hand and placed it in my right palm.

source_sentence: 力士見已，心生歡喜，復作是言：『沙門！
translation: Seeing this, the strong man was overjoyed and said:

source_sentence: 是石常耶？
translation: Is the stone permanent?

source_sentence: 是無常乎？』
translation: Is it impermanent?'

source_sentence: 我於爾時，以口吹之，石即散壞，猶如微塵。
translation: At the time, I blew it with my mouth, and the stone disintegrates like a speck of dust.

source_sentence: 力士見已唱言：『沙門！
translation: Seeing this, the strong man called out, 'Ascetic!

source_sentence: 是石無常。』
translation: This stone is impermanent.'

source_sentence: 即生愧心而自考責：『云何我等，恃怙自在色力命財，而生憍慢？』
translation: He then became ashamed and reproached himself, saying, 'How can we, relying on self-dependence in form, strength, life, and possessions, become conceited?'

source_sentence: 我知其心，即捨化身，還復本形而為說法。
translation: Knowing his mind, I abandoned my transformation body and returned to my original form to preach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 力士見已，一切皆發菩提之心。
translation: When the strong man saw this, all of them aroused the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 拘尸那竭有一工巧，名曰純陀，是人先於迦葉佛所，發大誓願：『釋迦如來入涅槃時，
translation: In Kuśinagara there was a skillful artisan named Cunda. This man had previously made the great vow before Kasyapa Buddha that when the Tathāgata Śākyamuni entered nirvana,

source_sentence: 我當最後奉施飲食。』
translation: I will give my final offering of food and drink.'

source_sentence: 是故我於毘舍離國，顧命比丘優波摩那：『善男子！
translation: Therefore, in Vaiśālī, I looked after the monk Upamāṇa and ordered him, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 過三月已，吾當於彼拘尸那竭娑羅雙樹，入般涅槃。
translation: After three months have passed, I will enter parinirvāṇa at the two śāla trees in Kuśinagara.

source_sentence: 汝可往告純陀令知。』
translation: You may go and tell Cunda to let him know.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 王舍城中有五通仙，名須跋陀，年百二十，常自稱是一切智人，生大憍慢，
translation: In the city of Rājagṛha there were five holy sages named Subhadra, all one hundred twenty years old. They always proclaimed themselves to be omniscient and gave rise to great arrogance.

source_sentence: 已於過去無量佛所，種諸善根，我亦為欲調伏彼故，告阿難言：『過三月已，
translation: Having planted roots of goodness in the presence of infinite buddhas of the past, I also want to tame them.” He said to Ānanda:

source_sentence: 吾當涅槃。
translation: I will enter nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 須跋聞已，當來我所，生信敬心，我當為彼說種種法，其人聞已，當得盡漏。』
translation: After hearing it, Subhadra will come to me and give rise to faith and respect, and I will explain various teachings for them; after hearing them, that person will end the contaminants.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 羅閱耆王頻婆娑羅，其王太子名曰善見，業因緣故，生惡逆心，欲害其父，
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla King Bimbisāra, the prince of that king named Sunetra, because of the causes and conditions of his evil deeds, gave rise to a bad and hostile mind in order to harm his father.

source_sentence: 而不得便。
translation: They can't get an advantage over it.

source_sentence: 爾時惡人提婆達多，亦因過去業因緣故，復於我所生不善心，欲害於我，
translation: At the time, that bad man Devadatta, also because of the causes and conditions of past actions, again had an unwholesome thought about what belonged to me, wanting to harm me.

source_sentence: 即修五通，不久獲得，與善見太子共為親厚。
translation: He cultivated the five supernatural powers and soon attained them, becoming intimate with Prince Sudarśana.

source_sentence: 為太子故，現作種種神通之事，從非門出、從門而入，從門而出、非門而入，
translation: For the sake of the prince, he does all kinds of spiritual deeds: coming out through a door that is not a door and entering through a door that is not a door; coming out through a door and entering through a door that is not a door

source_sentence: 或時示現象馬牛羊、男女之身。
translation: Sometimes they show the phenomenal bodies of horses, cattle, sheep, and men and women.

source_sentence: 善見太子見已，即生愛心、喜心、敬信之心，為是事故，嚴設種種供養之具而供養之，
translation: On seeing him, Prince Sudarśana felt affection, joy, reverence, and faith. For this reason he prepared various offerings for the prince to be honored.

source_sentence: 又復白言：『大師，聖人。
translation: Again, he said, 'Great master, noble person.

source_sentence: 我今欲見曼陀羅花。』
translation: Now, I want to see the maṇḍala flower.'

source_sentence: 時調婆達多即便往至三十三天，從彼天人而求索之，其福盡故，都無與者。
translation: Devadatta then went to the Trāyastriṃśa gods and begged for it from those gods and goddesses, but because their merit had run out, there was no one to give it.

source_sentence: 既不得花，作是思惟：『曼陀羅樹，無我、我所，我若自取，當有何罪？』
translation: Since he hadn't obtained the flowers, he thought, 'The maṇḍala tree has no self and nothing belongs to me; what sin would there be if I were to take it myself?'

source_sentence: 即前欲取，便失神通，還見己身，在王舍城。
translation: When he was about to take it, he lost his supernormal powers and returned to see himself in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 心生慚愧，不能復見善見太子，復作是念：『我今當往至如來所，求索大眾。
translation: With shame and embarrassment in his mind, he couldn't see Prince Sunetra again. Again, he thought, 'Now, I will go to the Tathāgata to solicit the crowd.

source_sentence: 佛若聽者，我當隨意教詔勅使舍利弗等。』
translation: If the Buddha hears it, I'll teach and order Śāriputra and so forth as I wish.'

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多便來我所，作如是言：『唯願如來，以此大眾付囑於我，
translation: Then Devadatta came to me and said: O Tathāgata, please entrust these matters to me.

source_sentence: 我當種種說法教化，令其調伏。』
translation: I will teach and transform them in various ways, so they'll be disciplined.'

source_sentence: 我言癡人：『舍利弗等聰明大智，世所信伏。
translation: I said to the deluded man, 'Śāriputra and others are so intelligent and greatly wise that the world believes in them.

source_sentence: 我猶不以大眾付囑，況汝癡人，食唾者乎？』
translation: I still won't entrust it to the public, so why wouldn't you foolish people who eat and spit?'

source_sentence: 時提婆達，復於我所倍生惡心，作如是言：『瞿曇！
translation: Devadatta then again became doubly angry with me and said, 'Gautama!

source_sentence: 汝今雖復調伏大眾，勢亦不久，當見磨滅。』
translation: Now, even though you've subdued the masses, your momentum won't be long; you'll see their grinding away.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，大地即時六返震動，提婆達多尋時躄地，於其身邊，出大暴風吹諸塵土，
translation: After he said these words, the earth immediately shook in six ways. At that moment Devadatta trembled to the ground and a great gust of wind came out from his beside him, blowing all the dust:

source_sentence: 而污坌之。
translation: He then defiles it and disfigures it.

source_sentence: 提婆達多見惡相已，復作是言：『若我此身現世必入阿鼻地獄，我要當報如是大怨。』
translation: After seeing these bad signs, Devadatta again said, 'If this body of mine were to enter avīci hell in the present life, I would have to repay such a great grudge.'

source_sentence: 時提婆達多，尋起往至善見太子所，善見見已即問：『聖人！
translation: Devadatta then got up and went to see Prince Sunetra, and after seeing him, Sunetra asked, 'Noble man!

source_sentence: 何故顏容憔悴，有憂色耶？』
translation: Why is your appearance so emaciated and sad?'

source_sentence: 提婆達言：『我常如是，汝不知乎？』
translation: Devadatta said, 'I'm always like this, don't you know?'

source_sentence: 善見答言：『願說其意何因緣爾？』
translation: Sunetra answered, 'What's the reason for wanting to explain its meaning?'

source_sentence: 提婆達言：『我今與汝極成親愛，外人罵汝以為非理，我聞是事，豈得不憂？』
translation: Devadatta said, 'Now that I'm extremely intimate with you, and outsiders ridicule you as unreasonable, how can I not grieve when I hear this?'

source_sentence: 善見太子復作是言：『國人云何罵辱於我？』
translation: Again, Prince Sunetra said, 'How did the people of my country abuse me?'

source_sentence: 提婆達言：『國人罵汝為未生怨。』
translation: Devadatta said, 'The people of the country scold you because you haven't yet become enemies.'

source_sentence: 善見復言：『何故名我為未生怨？
translation: Again, Sunetra said, 'Why is it called self because it doesn't give rise to grudges?'

source_sentence: 誰作此名？』
translation: Who makes this name?'

source_sentence: 提婆達言：『汝未生時，一切相師皆作是言，是兒生已當殺其父。
translation: Devadatta said, 'When you're not yet born, all the masters of characteristics say this, That child will kill his father after he's born.

source_sentence: 是故外人皆悉號汝為未生怨。
translation: That's why non-Buddhist people all praised you for not producing enemies.

source_sentence: 一切內人，護汝心故，謂為善見。
translation: All the people inside the monastery regard it as a good view because they want to protect your mind.

source_sentence: 韋提夫人聞是語已，既生汝身於高樓上，棄之於地，壞汝一指。
translation: After hearing these words, Lady Vedi gave birth to you in a high building and abandoned it on the ground, destroying your one finger.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，人復號汝為婆羅留枝。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, people again called you the Vārāṇasī branch.

source_sentence: 我聞是已，心生愁憒，而復不能向汝說之。』
translation: After hearing this, I became sad in heart and couldn't tell you about it.'

source_sentence: 提婆達多以如是等種種惡事，教令殺父：『若汝殺父，我亦能殺瞿曇沙門。』
translation: Devadatta instructed his father to kill him with these kinds of bad things, saying, 'If you kill your father, I can also kill the Gautama ascetic.'

source_sentence: 善見太子問一大臣，名曰雨行：『大王何故為我立字作未生怨？』
translation: The prince Sunetra asked a minister named Raiquan, 'Why did the great king establish words for me and create enemies that haven't yet arisen?'

source_sentence: 大臣即為說其本末，如提婆達所說無異。
translation: The minister then explained the source and derivative, just as Devadatta explained it, without any difference.

source_sentence: 善見聞已，即與大臣收其父王，閉之城外，以四種兵而守衛之。
translation: Upon hearing this, Sudarśana gave his ministers permission to detach the king from his father’s palace and shut him outside the city. He was guarded by four kinds of troops.

source_sentence: 韋提夫人聞是事已，即至王所，諸守王人，遮不聽入。
translation: When Lady Vedi heard this, she went to the king's place, and the guards of the king's palace prevented her from entering.

source_sentence: 爾時夫人生瞋恚心，便呵罵之。
translation: At that point, the man became angry and scolded him.

source_sentence: 時諸守人即告太子：『大王！
translation: The guards then addressed the prince, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 夫人欲得往見父王，不審聽不？』
translation: The lady wanted to go and see her father, but didn't she hear it?'

source_sentence: 善見聞已，復生瞋嫌，即往母所，前牽母髮，拔刀欲斫。
translation: On hearing this, Sudarśana became angry and went to his mother.

source_sentence: 爾時耆婆白言：『大王！
translation: It was then that the Jīvaka said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 有國已來，罪雖極重，不及女人，況所生母？』
translation: Since then, there's a country where even though their sins are so grave, they aren't as serious as women, so why wouldn't the mother who gives birth to them?'

source_sentence: 善見太子聞是語已，為耆婆故，即便放捨。
translation: After hearing these words, Prince Sudarśana abandoned them for the sake of the jīvaka.

source_sentence: 遮斷父王衣服臥具、飲食湯藥，過七日已，王命便終。
translation: He cut off his father’s clothes, bedding, food and drink, water and medicine. After seven days had passed, the king died.

source_sentence: 善見太子見父喪已，方生悔心，雨行大臣復以種種惡邪之法而為說之：『大王！
translation: Seeing his father's death, Prince Sudarśana then became remorseful, and the raining minister again explained various bad and evil ways to him, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 一切業行都無有罪，何故今者而生悔心？』
translation: All actions are blameless, so why do you now give rise to the mind of regret?'

source_sentence: 耆婆復言：『大王！
translation: Again, Jīvaka said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知如是業者，罪兼二種：一者殺害父王，二者殺須陀洹。
translation: You should know that such actions are of two kinds: first, killing one's father and king; and second, killing a stream entrant.

source_sentence: 如是罪者，除佛更無能除滅者。』
translation: Such a sin is like this, except for the Buddha, there's no one else who can remove it.'

source_sentence: 善見王言：『如來清淨，無有穢濁，我等罪人，云何得見？』
translation: King Sunetra said, 'The Tathāgata is pure and without defilement; how can we sinners see him?'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我知是事，故告阿難：『過三月已，吾當涅槃。
translation: Knowing this, I therefore tell Ānanda: After three months have passed, I shall enter nirvana.

source_sentence: 善見聞已，即來我所，我為說法，重罪得薄，獲無根信。』
translation: After hearing this, Sunetra came to me and taught the Dharma for me, weakening his serious sins and attaining faith without faculties.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，故作是言：『如來定說畢竟涅槃。』
translation: After hearing this explanation, my disciples didn't understand my meaning and therefore said, 'The Tathāgata will surely explain final nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: ◎「◎善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 菩薩二種：一者實義，二者假名。

source_sentence: 不自覺知，猶故放逸。

translation: Therefore, I will leave home and cultivate the path, ending the four kinds of enemies: birth, old age, illness, and death.'

source_sentence: 「又我一時為諸眾生說言：『我者即是性也，所謂內外因緣、十二因緣、眾生、五陰，

translation: The mind realm, world, world, virtue, karmic activity, and the self-contained heavens are called self.'

translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant, and they called out, The Tathāgata definitely says that there's a self.

source_sentence: 云何名我？

source_sentence: 其生之時，無所從來，及其滅時，亦無所至，雖有業果，無有作者，無有捨陰及受陰者。
translation: When it arises, there's no place to come from, and when it ceases, there's no place to go, even though there are actions and results, there's no author, and there's no equanimous aggregate or acquired aggregate.

source_sentence: 如汝所問，云何我者？
translation: As you ask, what is self?

source_sentence: 我即期也。

source_sentence: 誰是我者？

source_sentence: 即是業也。

source_sentence: 何緣我者？

source_sentence: 即是愛也。

source_sentence: 譬如二手相拍，聲出其中。
translation: It's like when the two hands are clapped, and sound emerges from them.

source_sentence: 我亦如是，眾生、業、愛三因緣故，名之為我。
translation: Because sentient beings, karma, and craving are the three causes and conditions for self, it's called self.

source_sentence: 比丘！

source_sentence: 一切眾生，色不是我、我中無色、色中無我，乃至識亦如是。
translation: All sentient beings, form isn't self, formlessness in self, formlessness in form, and selflessness in form, and so is consciousness.

source_sentence: 比丘！

source_sentence: 諸外道輩雖說有我，終不離陰，若說離陰別有我者，無有是處。

source_sentence: 一切眾生，行如幻化、熱時之焰。
translation: All sentient beings act like illusory transformations and the flames of hot seasons.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 五陰皆是無常、無樂、無我、無淨。
translation: The five aggregates are all impermanent, unhappy, selfless, and impure.

source_sentence: 善男子！

source_sentence: 善男子！

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於經中復作是言：『三事和合，得受是身：一父、二母、三者中陰；
translation: Again, in the sūtra I state: When these three things are combined, one can experience this body. The first is father; the second mother; and the third intermediate being.

translation: These are the three combined, and they'll be able to receive this body.'

source_sentence: 或時復說：『阿那含人現般涅槃，或於中陰入般涅槃。』

source_sentence: 「善男子！

source_sentence: 善男子，我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說定無中陰。

translation: Moreover, it is said that there are further two kinds of causes and conditions for falling back: one is internal and two are external.

source_sentence: 亦說眾生生煩惱因，凡有三種：一者未斷煩惱、二者不斷因緣、三者不善思惟。

source_sentence: 而阿羅漢無二因緣，謂斷煩惱無不善思惟。

source_sentence: 言生身者，即是方便應化之身。
translation: When it's called the body of birth, it's the body that's transformed by skillful means.

source_sentence: 如是身者，可得言是生老病死、長短黑白、是此是彼、是學無學。
translation: Such a body can be described as birth, old age, illness, death, length, blackness, whiteness, here and there, and training and post-learning.

source_sentence: 法身即是常樂我淨，永離一切生老病死、非白非黑、非長非短、非此非彼、非學非無學。
translation: The Dharma body is eternal, blissful, selfless, and pure, permanently free of all birth, old age, illness, death, neither white nor black, neither long nor short, neither here nor there, and neither learned nor post-learning.

source_sentence: 若佛出世及不出世，常住不動，無有變易。

translation: The self sūtra says, 'What are the twelve causes and conditions?'

source_sentence: 從無明生行，從行生識，從識生名色，從名色生六入，從六入生觸，從觸生受，
translation: From nescience there proceeds volition; from volition there proceeds consciousness; from consciousness there proceeds name-and-form; from name-and-form there proceeds the sixfold sense operation; from the sixfold sense operation there proceeds touch; and from touch there proceeds sensation.

source_sentence: 從受生愛，從愛生取，從取生有，從有生生，從生則有老死憂苦。』
translation: From sensation arises craving, from craving arises grasping, from grasping arises existence, and from existence arises birth, and from existence arises old age, death, sorrow, and pain.'

source_sentence: 我又一時告喻比丘，而作是言：『十二因緣有佛無佛，性相常住。

source_sentence: 善男子！

translation: There are twelve conditions that do not arise from conditions, and one that arise from conditions.

source_sentence: 非十二緣有從緣生，亦十二緣有非緣生非十二緣有。
translation: It is not that the twelve forms of existence arise from conditions. Nor are the twelve forms of existence conditioned or unconditioned arisen, and not the twelve forms of existence conditioned.

source_sentence: 十二緣非緣生者，謂未來世十二支也。
translation: The twelve conditions that are not conditioned arising refers to the twelve limbs of future existence.

source_sentence: 有從緣生非十二緣者，謂阿羅漢所有五陰。
translation: Someone who arises from conditions but not the twelve conditions refers to the five aggregates that are possessed by an arhat.

source_sentence: 有從緣生亦十二緣者，謂凡夫人所有五陰。
translation: “Some arise from conditions and also have twelve conditions”: All the five aggregates belonging to worldlings are with one condition.

source_sentence: 十二因緣有非緣生非十二緣者，謂虛空涅槃。』

source_sentence: 純惡業者心即下行。』
translation: The mind that's purely bad in karma is the next step.'

source_sentence: 善男子！

translation: If form were permanent, it would not disintegrate and give rise to suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 今見是色散滅破壞，是故當知色是無常，乃至識亦如是。』

source_sentence: 善男子！

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我經中說：『遠離煩惱未得解脫，猶如欲界修習世間第一法也。』
translation: In my sūtras, I say, 'I'm far removed from the afflictions and haven't yet attained liberation, just like cultivating the worldly highest dharma in the desire realm.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞作是說，不解我意，唱言如來說第一法唯是欲界。
translation: When my disciples heard me say this, they didn't understand what I meant and called out, saying, The Tathāgata teaches that the first dharma is only in the desire realm.

source_sentence: 又復我說：『暖法、頂法、忍法、世間第一法，在於初禪至第四禪。』
translation: Again, I say, 'The method of warmth, the topknot method, the method of forbearance, and the world's highest dharma are in the first dhyāna up to the fourth dhyāna.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說如是法在於色界。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata teaches such a teaching in the form realm.

source_sentence: 又復我說：『諸外道等，先已得斷四禪煩惱，修習暖法、頂法、忍法、世第一法，
translation: Again, I teach that non-Buddhists have previously abandoned the defilements of the fourth meditative state of absorption and practiced the Dharma of warmth, the Dharma of summit, the Dharma of patience, and the highest worldly dharma.

source_sentence: 觀四真諦，得阿那含果。』
translation: Observing the four true truths, he attains the fruit of non-returning.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說第一法在無色界。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called out, saying, The Tathāgata teaches that the first dharma is in the formless realm.

source_sentence: 「善男子，我經中說：『四種施中，有三種淨：一者施主信因、信果、信施，
translation: Good man, it is said in my sūtra: Among the four kinds of charity, there are three kinds of purity. The first is that which is relied upon by donors (i.e., self-benefiting), i.e., generosity based on faith; the second is that which is relied upon because of faith; and the third is that which is relied

source_sentence: 受者不信、因、果與施；
translation: The one who receives it does not believe in giving, causes, fruits and forms of giving.

source_sentence: 二者受者信因、果、施，施主不信因、果及施；
translation: The second is that the one who receives believes in causes, fruits and donations; the donor does not believe in causes, fruits and donations.

source_sentence: 三者施主受者，二俱有信；
translation: The third is the one who receives from the donor. Both have faith.

source_sentence: 四者施主受者二俱不信。
translation: Fourth, the donor and recipient are both unbelieving.

source_sentence: 是四種施，初三種淨。』
translation: These are the first three kinds of giving that are pure.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說施唯意。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant, and they called it the Tathāgata's teaching that giving is only meaningful.

source_sentence: 善男子，我於一時復作是說：『施者施時以五事施。
translation: Good man, one time I also said this: Giving is to give five things at the time of giving.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者施色、二者施力、三者施安、四者施命、五者施辯，以是因緣，施主還得五事果報。』
translation: One is the form of generosity, two are the power of generosity, three are the peacefulness of generosity, four are the life of generosity, and five are the eloquence of generosity; because of these causes and conditions, the donor will again attain the results of five things.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說施即五陰。
translation: Having heard this teaching, my disciples didn't understand what I meant by it, and they called out to the Buddha and taught that giving is the five aggregates.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於一時宣說：『涅槃即是遠離，煩惱永盡，滅無遺餘。
translation: At one time I preached that nirvana is seclusion. The defilements are permanently extinguished, and there is no residue in their cessation.

source_sentence: 猶如燈滅，更無法生，涅槃亦爾。
translation: It is just as when a lamp goes out, there is no more existence: the same applies to nirvana.

source_sentence: 言虛空者，即無所有，譬如世間無所有故，名為虛空。
translation: The expression space refers to nothingness, which is called space because it's like the world without existence.

source_sentence: 非智緣滅，即無所有。
translation: It is not the cessation of cognition as supporting object: that is, it does not exist.

source_sentence: 如其有者，應有因緣。
translation: If they did exist, there would be causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 有因緣故，應有盡滅。
translation: Because there are causes and conditions, there should be extinction.

source_sentence: 以其無故，無有盡滅。』
translation: Because it doesn't exist, there's no end and cessation.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說無三無為。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out to the Buddha who taught that there are no three unconditioned things.

source_sentence: 「善男子，我於一時，為目乾連而作是言：『目連！
translation: Good man, one time I spoke to Maudgalyāyana this way:

source_sentence: 夫涅槃者，即是章句、即是足跡、是畢竟處、是無所畏、即是大師、即是大果、是畢竟智、即是大忍無礙三昧、是大法界、是甘露味、即是難見。
translation: The nirvāṇa is the chapter and verse, which are the footprints, the ultimate abode, the fearlessness, the great teacher, the great fruit, the ultimate wisdom, the great forbearance, the unobstructed concentration, the great Dharma realm, the taste of ambrosia, which is difficult to see.

source_sentence: 目連！
translation: Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 若說無涅槃者，云何有人生誹謗者墮於地獄？』
translation: If someone says there's no nirvāṇa, then how could there be people who denigrate it and fall into hell?'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說有涅槃。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called it the Tathāgata who teaches that there's nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 「復於一時，我為目連而作是說：『目連！
translation: Again, there was another time when I spoke to Maudgalyāyana this way:

source_sentence: 眼不牢固，至身亦爾皆不牢固，不牢固故，名為虛空。
translation: The eye is not strong, and neither is the body. Because it is not strong, it is called space.

source_sentence: 食下迴轉，消化之處，一切音聲，皆名虛空。』
translation: Under food, it turns around, and where it's digested, all sounds are called space.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來決定說有虛空無為。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata has definitely taught that space exists without being.

source_sentence: 「復於一時為目連說：『目連！
translation: Again, there was another time when he said to Maudgalyāyana, 'Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 有人未得須陀洹果住忍法時，斷於無量三惡道報，當知不從智緣而滅。』
translation: When someone who hasn't yet attained the fruit of stream entry and abides in the principle of forbearance stops the results of measureless three bad destinies, they should know that they don't cease because of the condition of knowledge.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來決定說有非智緣滅。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata definitely says that there are cessations of cognition that lack cognition as a condition.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我又一時為跋波比丘說：『跋波！
translation: One time, I also said to the monk Upagupta, 'Upagupta!

source_sentence: 若比丘觀色已，若過去、若未來、若現在，若近、若遠、若麁、若細，
translation: “Suppose a monk observes form, whether past, future, or present, near, distant, coarse, or fine,

source_sentence: 如是等色，非我、我所。
translation: Such forms are not self or what belongs to self.

source_sentence: 若有比丘如是觀已，能斷色愛。』
translation: If a monk thus observes it, he'll be able to stop craving for form.'

source_sentence: 跋波又言：『云何名色？』
translation: Upagupta also said, 'What's called form?'

source_sentence: 我言：『四大名色，四陰名名。』
translation: I said, 'The four elements are called name and form, and the four aggregates are called names.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來決定說言，色是四大。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata definitely says that form is the four elements.

source_sentence: 「善男子，我復說言：『譬如因鏡，則有像現。
translation: Good man, I would like to elucidate the analogy of a mirror that produces images.

source_sentence: 色亦如是，因四大造，所謂麁細、澁滑、青黃赤白、長短方圓、斜角輕重、寒熱飢渴、煙雲塵霧，
translation: Form is also like this, created by the four elements: roughness, fineness, roughness, blue, yellow, red, white, long and short, square and round, slanted and angled, light and heavy, cold and hot, hunger and thirst, smoke and clouds, dust and mist.

source_sentence: 是名造色，猶如響像。』
translation: This is called creating form, just like an echo or an image.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說有四大則有造色，或有四大無有造色。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant. They called it the Tathāgata and said, 'There are four elements that have created form, or there may be four elements that have no created form.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 往昔一時，菩提王子作如是言：『若有比丘護持禁戒，若發惡心，當知是時失比丘戒。』
translation: One time in the past, the prince of enlightenment said this, 'If a monk observes the forbidden precepts and gives rise to bad thoughts, you should know that he'll then lose the monk's precepts.'

source_sentence: 我時語言：『菩提王子！
translation: I then said, 'Prince of enlightenment!

source_sentence: 戒有七種，從於身口、有無作色。
translation: There are seven kinds of moral precepts:

source_sentence: 以是無作色因緣故，其心雖在惡無記中，不名失戒，猶名持戒。
translation: Because of these unconstructed form causes and conditions, even though their minds are in bad and indeterminate states, they aren't called losing the precepts, but they're still called observing them.

source_sentence: 以何因緣名無作色？
translation: What is the reason it is called unmanifest matter?

source_sentence: 非異色因，不作異色因果。』
translation: It's not a cause that's different from form, and it doesn't create causes and effects that are different from form.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說有無作色。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out to the Buddha who said there was unconstructed form.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於餘經作如是言：『戒者即是遮制惡法，若不作惡是名持戒。』
translation: In other sūtras, I say, 'The precepts are to shield myself from bad qualities, and if I don't do evil, this is called observing the precepts.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來決定宣說，無無作色。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata definitely teaches that there are no unconstructed forms.

source_sentence: 「善男子，我於經中作如是說：『聖人色陰乃至識陰，皆是無明因緣所出。
translation: Good man, I have said in the sūtras: The aggregate of material form and so on, up to the aggregate of consciousness of the saints are all produced by ignorance as cause and condition.

source_sentence: 一切凡夫亦復如是，從無明生愛，當知是愛即是無明；
translation: All worldlings are also like this. From ignorance there proceeds thirst. You should know that thirst is ignorance.

source_sentence: 從愛生取，當知是取即無明愛；
translation: Grasping arises from thirst. It should be known that grasping is thirst of ignorance.

source_sentence: 從取生有，是有即是無明愛取；
translation: Consciousness arises from grasping. Being is craving and clinging to ignorance.

source_sentence: 從有生受，當知是受即是行有；
translation: Sensation arises from existence. It should be known that sensation is the conditioned existence of volition.

source_sentence: 從受因緣生於名色、無明、愛取、有行、受、觸、識、六入等，是故受者即十二支。』
translation: From the causes and conditions of sensation, name-and-form, nescience, craving and grasping, volition, sensation, touch, consciousness, the six sense-fields, and so forth arise from the causes and conditions of sensation; therefore, those who experience are the twelve limbs.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說無心數。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called it the Tathāgata's teaching without mental numbers.

source_sentence: 「善男子，我於經中作如是說：『從眼、色、明、惡欲等四，則生眼識。
translation: Good man, I say in the sūtras: From the eye, visible matter, light, bad desires, etc., there arises the consciousness of the eye.

source_sentence: 言惡欲者，即是無明。
translation: When it's called bad desire, it's ignorance.

source_sentence: 欲性求時，即名為愛。
translation: When the nature of desire is sought, it's called craving.

source_sentence: 愛因緣取，取名為業。
translation: Grasping for the causes and conditions of craving is called action.

source_sentence: 業因緣識，識緣名色，名色緣六入，六入緣觸，觸緣想、受、愛、信、精進、定慧。
translation: Karmic causes are the condition for consciousness, consciousness is the condition for name-and-form, name-and-form is the condition for the six sense-fields, touch is the condition for the six sense-fields, and touch is the condition for perception, sensation, feeling, craving, faith, effort, concentration, and wisdom.

source_sentence: 如是等法，因觸而生，然非是觸。』
translation: Such things arise because of touch, but they aren't touch.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說有心數。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called it the Tathāgata's explanation that there are mental numbers.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我或時說，唯有一有；
translation: Sometimes I teach that there is only one existence:

source_sentence: 或說二、三、四、五六七八九，至二十五。
translation: Some say two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, up to twenty-five.

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說有五有，或言六有。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called it the Tathāgata who teaches that there are five existences or six existences.

source_sentence: 「善男子，我往一時住迦毘羅衛尼拘陀林時，釋摩男來至我所，作如是言：『云何名為優婆塞也？』
translation: Good man, one time when I was staying at Kapilavastu in the forest of Kauṇḍinya, a man named Śākyamuni came to me and said, 'What's called a layman?'

source_sentence: 我即為說：『若有善男子、善女人，諸根完具，受三歸依，是則名為優婆塞也。』
translation: I then said, 'If there are good men and good women who have perfected their faculties and receive the three refuges, this is called a layman.'

source_sentence: 釋摩男言：『世尊！
translation: Śākyamuni said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何名為一分優婆塞？』
translation: What's called a partial layman?'

source_sentence: 我言：『摩男！
translation: I said, 'Man!

source_sentence: 若受三歸及受一戒，是名一分優婆塞也。』
translation: If someone receives the three refuges and receives one precept, this is called a partial layman.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說優婆塞戒不具受得。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata teaches the upāsaka precepts that aren't fully received.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於一時住恒河邊，爾時迦旃延來至我所，作如是言：『世尊！
translation: At one time, I was staying at the edge of the Ganges River when Kātyāyana came to me and said, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我教眾生令受齋法，或一日、或一夜、或一時、或一念，如是之人，成齋不耶？』
translation: Do I teach sentient beings to accept the rules for purification, whether it's for a day, a night, a time, or a single thought? Is such a person capable of purifying them?'

source_sentence: 我言：『比丘！
translation: I said, 'Monks!

source_sentence: 是人得善，不名得齋。』
translation: That person attains goodness, which isn't called attaining purification.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說八戒齋具受乃得。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and chanted, saying, The Tathāgata teaches the eight precepts that are received after observing them.

source_sentence: ◎「◎善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於經中作如是說：『若有比丘犯四重已，不名比丘，名破比丘、亡失比丘，
translation: If a monk commits one of the four grave offenses, he is not called a monk. He is called a broken monk or a lost monk.

source_sentence: 不復能生善牙種子。
translation: They won't be able to produce the seeds of good teeth again.

source_sentence: 譬如焦種不生果實，如多羅樹，頭若斷壞，則不生果。
translation: It's like a charred seed that doesn't produce fruit, like a palm tree whose head breaks down and doesn't produce fruit.

source_sentence: 犯重比丘亦復如是。』
translation: So it is with a monk who violates the precepts.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說，諸比丘犯重禁已，失比丘戒。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called it the Tathāgata. After violating a grave prohibition, the monks lost the monk's precepts.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於經中為純陀說：『四種比丘，一者畢竟到道、二者示道、三者受道、四者污道，
translation: I teach four kinds of bhikṣus to Cunda: the first is a bhikṣu who has attained the ultimate path; the second is a bhikṣu who shows the path; the third is a bhikṣu who receives the path; and the fourth is a bhikṣu who defiles the path.

source_sentence: 犯四重者即是污道。』
translation: Those who commit the four grave offenses are the defiled path.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說諸比丘犯四重已，不失禁戒。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata told the monks who violated the four grave offenses not to lose the precepts.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於經中告諸比丘：『一乘、一道、一行、一緣，如是一乘乃至一緣，
translation: I told the monks in the sutra, 'The One Vehicle, one path, one practice, one condition, and one condition are thus one vehicle... up to one condition.

source_sentence: 能為眾生作大寂靜，永斷一切繫縛、愁苦、苦及苦因，令一切眾到於一有。』
translation: They can create great quiescence for sentient beings and permanently end all the bonds, grief, pain, suffering, and the causes of suffering and cause all sentient beings to reach one existence.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說須陀洹乃至阿羅漢人皆得佛道。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and chanted, saying, The Tathāgata teaches that stream entrants and even arhats attain the Buddha Way.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於經中說：『須陀洹人，人間天上七返往來，便般涅槃。
translation: In the sūtras, I say, 'The stream-winner goes up and down seven times among humans and gods, and then he parinirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 斯陀含人，一受人天，便般涅槃。
translation: A once-returner who receives a human or divine bodhisattva will then attain parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 阿那含人，凡有五種，或有中間般涅槃者，乃至上流般涅槃者。
translation: There are five kinds of anāgāmins, some who attain parinirvāṇa in the interim or up to parinirvāṇa in the higher stream.

source_sentence: 阿羅漢人凡有二種，一者現在、二者未來，現在亦斷煩惱五陰，未來亦斷煩惱五陰。』
translation: Where there are two kinds of arhats, one is present and two are future, and the present also stops the five aggregates of affliction, and the future also stops the five aggregates of affliction.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言如來說須陀洹至阿羅漢不得佛道。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant by it and called out, saying, The Tathāgata teaches stream entry to arhats who don't attain the Buddha Way.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於此經說言：『佛性具有六事：一常、二實、三真、四善、五淨、六可見。』
translation: In this sūtra, I say, 'The buddha-nature has six things: one is permanent, two are real, three are true, four are good, five are pure, and six are visible.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說，眾生佛性離眾生有。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand my meaning and called out to the Buddha to teach that the buddha-nature of sentient beings exists apart from sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我又說言：『眾生佛性猶如虛空，虛空者非過去、非未來、非現在、非內、非外，
translation: The buddha-nature of sentient beings is like space, which is neither past, nor future, neither present, nor internal, nor external.

source_sentence: 非是色、聲、香、味、觸攝，佛性亦爾。』
translation: It's not the case that form, sound, odor, taste, or touch are included, and so is the buddha-nature.'

translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand my meaning and called out to the Buddha to teach that the buddha-nature of sentient beings exists apart from sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我又復說：『眾生佛性，猶如貧女宅中寶藏，力士額上金剛寶珠，轉輪聖王甘露之泉。』
translation: Again, I'll say, 'The buddha-nature of sentient beings is like the jeweled store in a poor woman's house, the vajra treasure pearl on the forehead of a strong man, and the ambrosia fountain of the wheel-turning sage king.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說，眾生佛性離眾生有。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand my meaning and called out to the Buddha to teach that the buddha-nature of sentient beings exists apart from sentient beings.

translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我又復說：『犯四重禁、一闡提人、謗方等經、作五逆罪，皆有佛性。
translation: Again, I've said, 'There are four grave offenses, icchantikas, people who denigrate the well-balanced sūtras, and commit the five heinous crimes all have buddha-nature.

source_sentence: 如是眾生都無善法，佛性是善。』
translation: Such sentient beings don't have good qualities, and the buddha-nature is good.'

translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我又復說：『眾生者即是佛性。
translation: Again, I've said, 'That sentient being is the buddha-nature.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 若離眾生，不得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: If they part with sentient beings, they won't attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 是故我與波斯匿王說於象喻，如盲說象，雖不得象，然不離象。
translation: That's why I spoke to King Prasenajit about the metaphor of an elephant, just as a blind man speaks of an elephant, even though he can't get an elephant, but he doesn't leave an elephant.

source_sentence: 眾生說色乃至說識是佛性者，亦復如是，雖非佛性，非不佛性。
translation: “So it is when beings say that matter up to and including consciousness are buddha-nature”: The same applies in exactly the same way. Although they are not with buddha-nature, they are not without buddha-nature.

source_sentence: 如我為王說箜篌喻，佛性亦爾。』
translation: As I explained the crude metaphor for the king, so is the buddha-nature.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，作種種說。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and made various explanations.

source_sentence: 如盲問乳，佛性亦爾，以是因緣，或有說言犯四重禁、謗方等經、作五逆罪、一闡提等，
translation: Like a blind man who asks for milk, so is the buddha-nature. Because of these causes and conditions, some say that someone has committed one of the four grave offenses, slandered well-balanced scriptures, committed the five heinous crimes, or committed icchantika.

source_sentence: 悉有佛性，或說言無。
translation: They all have buddha-nature, but some say they don't.

translation: There's no place for two buddhas in one world to appear in the world, and there's no place for them.

source_sentence: 一四天下，八四天王乃至二他化自在天，亦無是處。』
translation: There's no place for one of the four continents, eight of the four heavenly kings, or even two Paranirmita-vaśavartin gods.'

source_sentence: 然我乃說：『從閻浮提、阿鼻地獄，上至阿迦膩吒天。』
translation: Still, I said, 'From Jambudvīpa and Avīci Hell up to the Akaniṣṭha Heaven.'

source_sentence: 我諸弟子聞是說已，不解我意，唱言佛說，無十方佛。
translation: When my disciples heard this teaching, they didn't understand what I meant and called out to the Buddha to teach it, saying, There are no buddhas in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 我亦於諸大乘經中說有十方佛。
translation: I also say in the great vehicle scriptures that there are buddhas of the ten directions.
